document.docAuthor: Huber, John T., Read, Jennifer D. & Triapitsyn, Serguei V.
document.masterDocTitle: Illustrated key to genera and catalogue of Mymaridae (Hymenoptera) in America north of Mexico

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Illustrated key to genera and catalogue of Mymaridae (Hymenoptera) in America north of Mexico

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Anagrus incarnatus
Haliday, 1833b: 347
. Lectotype ♀ (NMID), designated by Graham , 1982: 200. TL: unknown, possibly UK , England.

Anagrus ( Anagrus ) incarnatus : Triapitsyn & Berezovskiy, 2004b: 18
(distribution);
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2802
(synonyms, redescription, distribution, hosts, genetic analysis); Triapitsyn et al ., 2019, 90 (synonyms, description, distribution, hosts morphometry, genetic analysis).

Anagrus ( Anagrus ) columbi :
Chiappini et al ., 1996: 560
(key), 579 (description);
Triapitsyn, 2015b: 12
(key), 28 (description, distribution).

Anagrus breviphragma Soyka, 1956a: 25
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: unknown—not specified ( Chiappini, 1989 ). Synonymy by
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 216
.

Anagrus danicus Soyka, 1956a: 26
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: Denmark , near Copenhagen. Synonymy by
Triapitsyn, 1997: 8
and
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2802
(
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 216–217
reinstated the previous synonymy under
A. incarnatosimilis
by
Chiappini, 1989: 113
).

Anagrus incarnatosimilis Soyka, 1956a: 25
(in key). Lectotype ♀ (NHMW), designated by
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 217
. TL: Austria , Lower Austria , Hundsheim. Synonymy by
Triapitsyn, 1997: 7
and
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2802
(
Triapitsyn 2015a: 216
reinstated it as a valid taxon).

Anagrus longigaster Soyka, 1956a: 25
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: Austria , Krössbach. Synonymy by
Chiappini, 1989: 105
(under
A. breviphragma
) and
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 216
(under
A . incarnatus
).

Anagrus mutans I. Walker, 1979: 199
. Holotype ♀ (NHMUK). TL: UK , England , Sunninghill, Silwood Park, Imperial College Field Station. Synonymy by
Triapitsyn, 1997: 8
and
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2803
(
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 217
reinstated the previous synonymy under
A. incarnatosimilis
by
Chiappini, 1989: 113
).

Anagrus neopallidus Soyka, 1956a: 26
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: Austria , Hundsheim. Synonymy by
Chiappini 1989: 112
and
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2802
(from the synonymy under
A. incarnatosimilis
by
Triapitsyn 2015a: 217
).

Anagrus nilaparvatae Pang & Wang, 1985: 176
. Holotype ♀ (SCAC). TL: China , Guangdong , Wushan (Fuoshan). Synonymy by
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2803
.

Anagrus ovipositor Soyka, 1956a: 25
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: Germany , Jettchenshof [a farm ≈ 2.5 km N. of Mal- chin]. Synonymy by
Chiappini, 1989: 105
(under
A. breviphragma
) and
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 216
(under
A . incarnatus
).

Anagrus pallidior Soyka, 1956a: 26
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: Austria , Hundsheim. Synonymy by
Chiappini 1989: 112
and
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2802
(from the synonymy under
A. incarnatosimilis
by
Triapitsyn 2015a: 217
).

Anagrus pulcher Soyka, 1956a: 25
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: Poland , Domaszczyn ( Triapitsyn, 2015a ). Synonymy by
Triapitsyn, 1997: 7
and
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2802
(
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 217
reinstated the previous synonymy under
A. incarnatosimilis Soyka
by
Chiappini, 1989: 113
).

Anagrus pulcherrimus Soyka, 1956a: 26
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: Austria , Hundsheim. Synonymy by
Triapitsyn, 1997: 7
and
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2802
(
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 217
reinstated the previous synonymy under
A. incarnatosimilis
by
Chiappini, 1989: 113
).

Anagrus silwoodensis I. Walker, 1979: 199
. Holotype ♀ (NHMUK). TL: UK , England , Sunninghill, Silwood Park, Imperial College Field Station. Synonymy by
Chiappini, 1989: 105
(under
A. breviphragma
) and
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 216
(under
A . incarnatus
).

Anagrus stenocrani I. Walker, 1979: 198
. Holotype ♀ (NHMUK). TL: UK , England , Sunninghill, Silwood Park, Imperial College Field Station. Synonymy by
Triapitsyn, 1997: 8
and
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2803
(
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 217
reinstated the previous tentative synonymy under
A. incarnatosimilis
by
Chiappini, 1989: 113
).

Anagrus supremus Soyka, 1956a: 25
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: Austria , Hundsheim. Synonymy by
Chiappini, 1989: 105
(under
A. breviphragma Soyka
) and
Triapitsyn, 2015b: 216
.

Anagrus vacuipennis Soyka, 1956a: 25
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: Austria , Hundsheim. Synonymy by
Chiappini, 1989: 105
(under
A. breviphragma
) and
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 216
(under
A. incarnatus
).

Anagrus varicolor Soyka, 1956a: 26
(in key). Syntype ♀ (NHMW). TL: Austria , Hundsheim. Synonymy by
Triapitsyn, 1997: 7
and
Triapitsyn et al. , 2018: 2802
(
Triapitsyn, 2015a: 217
reinstated the previous synonymy under
A. incarnatosimilis
by
Chiappini, 1989: 113
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Nearctic hosts . Cicadellidae :
Macrosteles divisus (Uhler)
. Delphacidae : “
Liburnia
” sp.,
Prokelisia crocea (Van Duzee)
,
Prokelisia
sp.
Distribution . Canada : SK. USA : AZ, CA, CO, IL, MN, ND, OH, PA, WY.
